conclusion: The problem involves analyzing a U-I graph of a power source and a small light bulb to find the output power and total power of the power source.
The graph shows a straight line (power source) and a curve (small light bulb). The intersection point is at \( U = 2 \, \text{V} \) and \( I = 2 \, \text{A} \).
The intersection point indicates the operating point where the voltage across the light bulb is 2 V and the current is 2 A.
The output power of the power source is calculated as \( P_{\text{out}} = U \times I = 2 \, \text{V} \times 2 \, \text{A} = 4 \, \text{W} \).

The total power of the power source is determined by the product of the emf and the current, which is \( P_{\text{total}} = \text{emf} \times I = 3 \, \text{V} \times 2 \, \text{A} = 6 \, \text{W} \).
The output power of the power source is 4 W and the total power of the power source is 6 W.
